channel.title: Fastest way to level agility from level 1!
channel.description:
Today I was browsing DI forums and stumbled upon a gold mine of agility xp for people with very low agility, let me explain.
Step 1: Buy a toy mouse from somebody off of the RS forums under the construction market section for 3-5k per mouse(Or if your 42 Construction you can make, also I bought 2 and ofc evil bob the cat pops up and takes me away from my first mouse)
Step 2: Wind the toy mouse and then release, attempt to catch it and you will receive 15 experience even if you fail so do the math...
Step 3: In just one hour you have gained 40k-50k Agility experience.
Hope you all decide to use this method, I went from 5-14 agility in less than 3 minutes flat.. See in RS2 2008 they changed the experience toy mice give to 3xp... awesome right? We got lucky this isn't RS08...
Anyways, credit to DI forums for the great info and come up. If you have any questions post here, hope this helped.

item.title: Fastest way to level agility from level 1!
item.dc:creator: @Chrix Chrix
item.description:
@Chrix wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:36, topic:506861”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=625093.msg4264585#msg4264585 date=1363887478]
Clockwork mice were giving too much Agility xp and have been fixed.
Clockwork mice were giving too much Agility xp and have been fixed.
Clockwork mice were giving too much Agility xp and have been fixed.

Clockwork mice were giving too much Agility xp and have been fixed.
Clockwork mice were giving too much Agility xp and have been fixed.
[/quote]

What the fuck.[/quote]

Yep knew it was to good to be true… all good things come to an end due to Jagex idiots. Oh well guess this guide is useless now, I suggest using Latifundo’s way in edge dungeon.

item.title: Fastest way to level agility from level 1!
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

Edgeville dungeon monkey bars are fast 20 xp each time, and if you set the camera right don’t even need to move the mouse just keep clicking :D. And the npcs stop agro after a while too.

item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

RSCShadow:

You’re gunna need more than one. Usually 8 is a good number if you’re a higher agility level. Just a reminder, if you take too long to pick them up, they instantly appear to everyone and people will steal them!

unless you’re in a super secret location.

item.title: Fastest way to level agility from level 1!
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:26, topic:506861”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=625093.msg4256014#msg4256014 date=1362781650]

Be aware that a few are fake, like @babyranger94 selling 4578x at 3.5k ea. If he had ~70 con that might be reasonable, but he has 1.

They’re being merched a lot right now so anyone could have any number of them lol
[/quote]

and I prove my point :)[/quote]
No, you prove that some people put fake numbers on. 5k of an item isn’t much if you’re merching it if I’m honest.

Read full topic

item.title: Fastest way to level agility from level 1!
item.dc:creator: @Chrix Chrix
item.description:
@Chrix wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:26, topic:506861”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=625093.msg4256014#msg4256014 date=1362781650]

Be aware that a few are fake, like @babyranger94 selling 4578x at 3.5k ea. If he had ~70 con that might be reasonable, but he has 1.

They’re being merched a lot right now so anyone could have any number of them lol
[/quote]

and I prove my point :)[/quote]

You can’t always believe the prices on those sites or bots, for example who would have 2147483647x at 4294967295? Also people attempting to sell at 10k or 30k each are looking for somewhat of a quick come up so just ignore those insane prices.

Read full topic

item.title: Fastest way to level agility from level 1!
item.dc:creator: @Chrix Chrix
item.description:
@Chrix wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:24, topic:506861”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=625093.msg4256142#msg4256142 date=1362797337]
I don’t see the point in spending 1K+ for 15xp… Just a HUGE money burner.
[/quote]

I tested…

Spin mouse
Release
attempt to catch
fail = try again + 15exp
success = start at step one

You really want to fail… so u can mass click :/[/quote]

Agreed, if you spam click the mouse on the initial release you will get more fails than actual catches.

Read full topic
